subject: p12433541
History: -year-old with metastatic non-small cell carcinoma with strep bacteremia and epidural abscess. Rule out pneumonia.
Findings: It is difficult to compare this exam with the previous one on because of the rotation of the patient in the last exam. In comparison to the one on , the right hilar region is more dense and more convex mostly in its lower region. There is also underlying post-radiation changes with volume loss. Small right pleural effusion. There is no evidence of pneumonia. There is no pneumothorax. The left lung is unremarkable. The mediastinal and cardiac contour is unchanged.
Impression: There is no evidence of pneumonia. The right hilar region appears more dense and more convex which is worrisome for progression of the malignancy. A CT scan is suggested.
